Frequently Asked Questions (FAQS)
What is Madcow 5x5?
Madcow is a 5x5 training program aimed at intermediate lifters who has utilised the capability of their beginner strength on a beginner program such as StrongLift 5x5
Do I need to squat 3 times a week?
Wednesday is a light squat day where you will be squatting less weight than on Monday or Friday. The light day provides you with extra physical and mental recovery for Friday's workout
What days should I workout on?

It is best to have 24 hours rest between each of the three workouts. After the third workout, it would be ideal to give your body 48 hours to recover completely. An example of the days you can run the program on is: Monday-Wednesday-Friday or Tuesday-Thursday-Saturday
How is the first workout calculated?

In this workout, you’re “ramping” up to a single top set of 5 on the barbell squat, bench press, and barbell row. After a few weeks on the program, the top set is intended to be a PR set. Using 12.5% jumps between sets, you’re going to end up doing 5×5.
How is the second workout calculated?

In this workout, you do four “ramping” sets on the barbell squat and overhead press. This workout is a bit of a “lighter” day because you only do two sets of 5 at 75% rather than fully ramping up to a 100% set of 5. However, this session isn’t that “light” because you’re also doing a 4×5 ramped deadlift workout! And that deadlift workout culminates in a 100% heavy set of 5 which is intended to be a PR after the first few weeks of the program.
How is the third workout calculated?

This workout is crucial to understanding the innerworkings of Madcow’s. You’re going to do almost the exact same workout as Monday except every single set is going to be 2.5% heavier. Instead of a top set of 5, you’re only going to do a top set of three. This top set triple is going to feel “easier” than Monday, but Friday is actually more work because after you hit that triple you have to do a back-off set of 8 at 77.5% of Monday’s top set. Friday is the day on Madcow’s that primarily drives progress on Mondays.
Do I need to the accessory work?

You do not need to carry out the accessory work however, it is highly recommended. The accessory work included is targeted to benefit the program with goals to increase your strength and build muscle.
Can I choose my own accessory work>
Of course! The accessory work is completely flexible to your own liking. Be careful not to do too much accessory work that can cause fatigue and affect your next workout session.
WELCOME TO MADCOW 5X5
BUILD MUSCLE AND STRENGTH
ENTER YOUR MAX LIFTS TO START
GET STARTED
Madcow 5x5 is a 3 day intermediate powerlifting program
Work on the main compound movements, Bench Press, Overhead Press, Barbell Squats, Deadlift and Barbell Rows to build muscle and strength
Remember starting too light is better than too heavy - let it be easy the first weeks in order to focus on technique and speed, and only aim to break PRs starting week 4
